name: The Postponement Online Quiz | 'Seinfeld' - Season 7 | 10 Questions

questions.text: Which character is shown trying to park their car in the beginning of the episode?
questions.explanation:
Kramer.

	In the beginning of the episode, Elaine tells Jerry that her dog problem, seen in the previous episode "The Engagement", is over as one of her neighbours, a rabbi with a TV show, has politely asked the dog owner to stop their pet from barking.  Meanwhile, Kramer is parking his car nearby, only he's trying to fit it into a very small space.  He ends up hitting two cars on the way in.

questions.text: Rabbi Kirschbaum has his own radio show.
questions.explanation:
False.

	Rabbi Kirschbaum, the man responsible for stopping Elaine's dog problems, has his own cable television show.  When Elaine goes back to her apartment, the Rabbi notices that she is troubled and has a session with her.  Meanwhile, George is surprised that his fiancée, Susan, does not want to have a conversation about toilets during their lunch together, so he goes to Jerry to ask if it's odd, and if he made the right choice in proposing to her.

questions.text: What idea does George consider during his lunch with Susan?
questions.correct: Extending the door length of the toilet stalls at Yankee Stadium to the floor
options: Using two-ply toilet paper in the bathroom stalls at Yankee Stadium
Removing wheelchair-accessible washrooms from Yankee Stadium
questions.explanation:
Extending the door length of the toilet stalls at Yankee Stadium to the floor.

	When George asks Jerry about the odd comment that Susan made during lunch, he happens to agree and he enjoys George's idea to lower the door length.  Both of them agree that a topic need not be changed since it should resolve itself.  Meanwhile, Kramer is nervous about the dog that he, Newman, and Elaine stole in the previous episode as he feels that the situation may tarnish his permanent records.

questions.text: In which month did George and Susan originally plan to get married?
questions.explanation:
December.

	In order to assess things better, George wonders if he should ask Susan to postpone the wedding until the spring.  Jerry feels that he is entitled to do that, so George decides to go through with it and he asks for a revised date of March 21st, the first day of spring.  Meanwhile, Elaine chats with the Rabbi about George's engagement and she comments that she wishes it were her getting married instead of George.

questions.text: Which movie do Jerry and Kramer plan to see in this episode?
questions.explanation:
Plan 9 from Outer Space.

	After Kramer stops at a coffee shop, Jerry notices a poster on the wall for a single viewing of "Plan 9 from Outer Space", which he tried to see in the second season episode "The Chinese Restaurant".  The two decide to check it out.  Meanwhile, George tells Susan his idea to postpone the wedding and she breaks into tears.  George quickly retracts the idea and they continue to set the date for December.

questions.text: Who does Rabbi Kirschbaum tell first about Elaine's problems?
questions.explanation:
Jerry.

	After Elaine's conference with the Rabbi, Jerry meets the Rabbi on the front steps of Elaine's apartment building.  Here, the Rabbi tells Jerry that Elaine was feeling hostile and bitter regarding the upcoming marriage  Meanwhile, prior to this encounter, George had been talking to Jerry at the coffee shop and they had watched a man simply ignoring his girlfriend when she was crying.  This gives George the motivation to return home and tell Susan that he means to change their wedding date.

questions.text: George is able to change his wedding date.
questions.explanation:
True.

	After witnessing the events at the coffee shop, George heads home and decides to have another try at changing the date with Susan.  Instead of talking to her sternly, he simply pretends to break down and cry, claiming that he needs more time because he's too afraid about their relationship to have such an early date.  This plan, oddly enough, works and the date is set for March 21st.

questions.text: What type of drink does Kramer sneak into the movie theater?
questions.explanation:
Cafe Latte.

	Before seeing the movie with Kramer, Jerry talks to Elaine about the Rabbi and he tells her that he let out all of the information from their talk (which she thought would be confidential).  After, Jerry and Kramer arrive at the theater, and Kramer is enjoying another café latte.  When Jerry remarks that people can't bring outside drinks into the movie theater, Kramer hides the cup in his pants to get it into the movie.

questions.text: The Rabbi ends up telling Elaine's information to a guy that she likes on which floor of her building?
questions.explanation:
Fifth.

	Throughout the episode, Elaine mentions the good-looking guy on the fifth floor, but when she asks the Rabbi who he told about the information, it is revealed that he met the man in the elevator and discussed her problems with him.  Meanwhile, at the movie theater, Kramer spills the coffee on the way to his seat, and when the usher comes along, Jerry rats him out.

questions.text: After Elaine talks with the Rabbi, he doesn't discuss the information regarding her feelings towards George again.
questions.explanation:
False.

	Although Elaine hates the idea of George getting married, she happily hugs and congratulates him when she sees him at the apartment.  Later, the Rabbi hosts his show about friendship and discusses Elaine's problems on live TV.  George and Susan watch this from home.  Kramer returns home and tells Jerry that although he got burns from the coffee, he's suing the coffee shop because the drink was too hot.
